meanings.definition: Bunkies (noun): Small, separate sleeping quarters typically found in cottages or cabins.
meanings.sent1: The bunkies in the cabin were cozy and perfect for a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: We stayed in separate bunkies during our camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The bunkies were so tiny, it felt like sleeping in a dollhouse!
meanings.sent4: The bunkies were like little havens of rest in the midst of the forest.
meanings.sent5: I'll never forget the peaceful feeling of the bunkies under the starry sky.

meanings.definition: Bunkies (verb): To share a bunk or sleeping space with someone else.
meanings.sent1: I bunkied with my brother on the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: During the sleepover, we bunkied together in the same room.
meanings.sent3: It was fun to bunkies with my friend, even though he snored loudly!
meanings.sent4: We bunkied like old pals, chatting late into the night.
meanings.sent5: Bunkying with my sister made me feel safe and comfortable in the unfamiliar room.
